textBox.richText: I just had the most amazing dream, and not necessarily in the good connotation of that word. It was about Southampton and what it could have been. For some reason, my family and I were out there on the campus visiting. It was before school was starting, and there were people everywhere. Everyone seemed so happy to be walking around associating; everyone knew each other, and I knew them as well. There was a basketball hoop near what I think was Chancellor’s Hall (why the aspect of basketball was in my dream, I’ll never know), and someone I knew was shooting hoops. And then there was this girl, shooting hoops as well. She seemed to be a freshman; an incoming student to this upcoming year. One of her shots had rebounded and came over towards me where I then threw it back to her. She gladly accepted. The actual area of the school where my dream took place--Chancellor’s Hall--looked different too: it was partway intertwined with the outside (which was where the basketball hoop was). The main hallway opened up with a crossways section of an outside pathway, covered in brilliant green grass with an expansive bench towards the back whereupon I was sitting. I believe this bench was a rendition of the preexisting benches that sat parallel to the wall-sized windows that existed in the actual building. It seemed like a utopia of sorts. This whole area, like I said, was filled with students. I also remember someone coming and sitting next to me, who I knew as well, and we chatted it up (for as much as I can remember, anyway; I don’t really recall in-dream exchanges). And then, just like that, I was bluntly thrust into the world by the alarming buzzer of my alarm. It was just all so nice. …And sad as well. I remember the feeling of tears welling up as I thought about all of this and walked around and saw the school logo in various places. I guess some things just weren’t meant to be. I seem to have a lot of that right now.
